snippet: A trade association said demand from passengers would increase faster than airlines bolstered their carrying capacity, driving projected profit of $12.7 billion.
abstract: International Air Transport Assn reports that world's airlines will earn $12.7 billion in profit in 2013, up 67 percent from $7.6 billion in 2012, as travel demand accelerates faster than airlines add seats.
lead_paragraph: A trade association said demand from passengers would increase faster than airlines bolstered their carrying capacity, driving projected profit of $12.7 billion.

headline.main: Airline Group Is Predicting Rising Profit
headline.print_headline: Airline Group Is Predicting Rising Profit
